definition: abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Seal, blue and white, the Chinese element.
sentences.chinese: 印章，青花瓷，最中國的元素。

sentences.english: Blue and white porcelain has a white base with blue designs.
sentences.chinese: 青花瓷是一種白地藍花的瓷器。

sentences.english: Blue and white porcelain is broken, five field of the earth return to embrace.
sentences.chinese: 青花瓷碎，五方土重歸中華大地懷抱。
青花瓷筆純陶瓷燒製的筆。

sentences.english: There are two huge, delicate blue-and-white porcelain bowls in my home.
sentences.chinese: 我家有兩個青花瓷海碗，做工很精緻。

sentences.english: Judy collects blue and white china.
The emergence of blue and white porcelain is of epoch-making significance in porcelain history.
sentences.chinese: 青花瓷的出現，在陶瓷史上具有劃時代的意義。

sentences.english: Underglaze blue is a kind of famous underglaze in Chinese ceramic history.
sentences.chinese: 青花瓷是中國陶瓷史上有名的釉下彩。

sentences.english: Blue and white porcelain developed and spread quickly after its emergence.
sentences.chinese: 青花瓷一經出現，迅速地得到傳播和發展。

sentences.english: So beautiful, for example , the song qinghuaci, is soft, not noisy.
sentences.chinese: 還好呀，比如《青花瓷》就很清柔，不會吵。

definition: celadon, classic Chinese style of ceramic glaze
bone china (fine white porcelain made from a mixture of clay and bone ash)
Xuande Emperor, reign name of fifth Ming emperor Zhu Zhanji 朱瞻基[Zhu1 Zhan1 ji1] (1398-1435), reigned 1426-1436, Temple name 明宣宗[Ming2 Xuan1 zong1]
Sichuan embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4])
